PROFESSOR: Welcome
to a new teaching, new lecturing of 8.421.

8.421 is an advanced course in
atomic physics-- graduate level

course. 8.421 is part of a new semester
sequence in atomic physics.

Actually, 8.421 is taken
first in this sequence

because we start with more basic

that you can start
with 8.422 or 8.421.

So just to get an idea, who

OK, great. So yes, you're not

And maybe for those of you
it's a little bit anticlimactic because you had all the fun.

You saw all the

and I explain to you what
are those two levels. What happens to those two

and electric fields? How are what they modified by

I talk about some course

But let me first point
out that you're interested

or you're doing research in

AMO science is booming
and is rapidly advancing.

And a lot of it is really
do to, well, of course,

new insight, new ideas,

We have seen over the

If I remember what lasers
I have used in my PH.D.

And what lasers you were using,
well, there's a big difference. Big difference in performance

The Ti:sapphire laser, which

But then it can

the spectral range.

So those advanced lasers

We have seen major advances

well, they're required.

Sometimes you

cooling nanokelvin temperature,

they feel out each other. And that means suddenly

to do many-body physics. So the event of quantum
degenerate gases

and many developments after that
with optical lattices and lots of bells and
whistles really meant

that-- and this dramatic--
that atomic physics has made the transition
from single and two particle
physics to many body physics.

And for several research
groups in this end of what are called
atoms, this is, of course, an
important point here.

Well, somewhat related to

the precision and
preparation and manipulation

One can say that

if I want to define it

in the most abstract

want to harness

parts of Hilbert space,
which are characterized by quantum entanglement.

Maybe single forms
between two particles but also between many particles.

And of course, this is it
to a whole new frontier in quantum computation and

So this sort of should show

control, and manipulation

And just to add something

research direction

in AMO physics dealing
with cold molecules.

And they're even prospects

is atomic physics
has been successful

because it continues
to redefine itself.

And to prove the case, I

try because I know
it wouldn't work. But if I tried to

What happens is just
breakthroughs and discoveries.

And usually they happen in areas
where they are not predicted.

we awarded for

Whether it was laser cooling
just invented in the '80s.

a few years, lets say,
over the last five or 10 years.

rich the physics of
simple systems are.
